name: Aggression
step1: Give the pet some affection
step2: Give them some food to eat
step3: Let them rest
step4: Talk with the pet about their problems
step6: Have a supervised playime with another pet

name: Appetite Gain
step1: Check the food they have been eating
step2: Take their temperature
step3: Weigh the pet on a scale
step4: Ask the pet how much exercise they get each day
step6: Do a yoga story with the pet

name: Appetite Loss
step1: Check the food they have been eating
step2: Take their temperature
step3: Weigh the pet on a scale
step4: Give the pet something healthy to eat
step5: Talk to the pet about their problems
step6: Give the pet more food to eat

name: Back Pain
step1: Check the pet's back for any injuries
step2: Wrap the pet in some bandage to keep thier back straight
step3: Lay them down in a soft place
step4: Play some card games with the pet until their back heals
step5: Take them on a slow walk to see if their back has healed
step6: Make sure the pet doesn't do anything to injure their back again

name: Bad breath
step1: Check the pet's food for stinky onions or garlic
step2: Take a look inside the pet's mouth
step3: Remove any badness that you find in the pet's mouth
step4: Ask the pet how often they brush their teeth
step6: Give the pet a breath mint

name: Behavior Changes
step1: Ask the pet what seems to be bothering them
step2: Try to fix anything they mention
step3: Let them rest
step4: Give them some food to eat
step6: Have them back in 1 week to check progress

name: Bloating
step1: Meaure the pet's belly
step2: Ask the pet if they recently swallowed any large
step3: If they haven't, then probably have gas
step4: Give them an Antacid
step5: Give them 1 glass of water to drink
step6: Help them burp out all the gas

name: Breathing Difficulties
step1: Check the pet's mouth for anything that might be stuck in their throat
step2: If you find a whistle or anything else, pull it out
step3: If there is nothing stuck, then put them on oxygen
step4: Give them 2 more treatments of oxygen
step5: Have them back in 1 week to check progress
step6: If still having trouble breathing, give them more oxygen

name: Coughing
step1: Take their temperature
step2: Ask the pet how often they are coughing
step3: Check their throat to see if it is red
step4: Give them a throat lozenge
step5: Instruct the pet to cover their mouth when they cough
step6: Have them back in 1 week to check progress

name: Dehydration
step1: Give the pet some water to drink
step2: Give the pet a bath in some clean water
step3: Give the pet more water to drink
step4: Ask the pet why they haven't been drinking enough water
step5: Give them more water to drink
step6: Take them swimming for at least 1 hour

name: Depression
step1: Exercise with the pet
step2: Give the pet something to chew on
step3: Exercise with the pet

name: Very Thirsty
step1: Take a blood sample
step2: Take a urine sample
step3: Give the pet medicine to control cortisol
step4: Give regular checkups

name: Lots of Drool
step1: Check teeth and gums.
step2: If something is stuck, gently pull it out.
step3: Brush and floss teeth.
step4: GIve them water to drink.

name: Itchy Ears
step1: Check ears for dirt or bugs
step2: Clean the ears with wipes
step3: Apply "ointment" to ears
step4: Give hugs and loves and send them away

name: Eyes Are Red
step1: Check eyeballs for foreign objects.
step2: If no foreign object, check for runny nose.

name: Fainting
step1: Hold something smelly under the pets nose to revive it
step2: If pet revives, make sure they've eaten
step3: Verify the pet is not over excited or worked.

name: Falling
step1: Check all joints for mobility
step2: Any joint that clicks or locks up, take an X-ray
step3: Broken leg? Wrap with gauze and set in a splint
step4: Don't forget the antibiotics and pain meds!

name: Fever
step1: Check gums, nose, eyes and ears
step2: If the pet is lethargic, draw blood
step3: Give pet water and small amount of food.
step4: Blood counts are perfect!  Minor infection, give antibiotics.

name: Hair Loss
step1: Take temperature, check eyes, ears, gums, and nose.
step2: Comb the pet's hair to make sure there are no fleas.
step3: If no fleas, take a skin scraping and send to lab
step4: Possibility of Mange, use a special shampoo for all baths, and give "mite" treatment

name: Head Shaking
step1: Check ears
step2: Ears are dirty!  Clean them
step3: If there are things crawling in the ears, check for mites
step4: Use Mite ear cleaner to wipe ears

name: Inflammed Joints
step1: Check the age of pet
step2: See what food the pet is on
step3: Give pet glucosamine tablets
step4: Have them take tylenol to help with pain

name: Itching All Over
step1: Comb pet with flea comb
step2: Ask when they last had their flea medicine
step3: If over a month ago, give them new flea medicine
step4: Give them a flea bath

name: Trouble Walking
step1: Touch pad of feet and legs for any tender areas
step2: If they jerk their feet away, look closer at feet for wound
step3: Open wound requires a cleaning and wrap
step4: No wound?  check toenails and make sure they are short enough for pet to walk.

name: Always Tired
step1: Ask the pet what time they've been going to bed
step2: Ask what time they've been waking up.
step3: If pet is receiving less than 8 hours of sleep, they need to go to bed sooner.

name: Odor Coming From Ear
step1: Look in the ears
step2: If ears are dirty, clean them
step3: Make sure ears are not red and inflamed
step4: Prescribe antibiotics if infected
step5: If not infected, make sure ears are cleaned on a regular basis

name: Odor Coming From Rear End
step1: Tell the animal to go POOP
step2: Make sure the animals bottom is cleaned with no residual fecal matter left behind.
step3: See what the pet has eaten lately
step4: Remind pet that people food is NOT for them.

name: Cold
step1: Cover the pet with a blanket
step2: Give the pet a warm drink and warm food
step3: Snuggle with the pet
